My team just got swerve working for the first time, and we want to use field orientation for the controls, but we cannot figure out how to implement it. Do we need to add entirely new code or just change a variable? Here’s our code: GitHub - 9668Kenner/9668: Code for FRC Team 9668 , the current folder is robot, not src/main

It seems that you are currently driving the robot in a field-relative mode based on the current code setup. I recommend checking to ensure that your gyro is providing accurate outputs. If the gyro is consistently returning a heading of ‘0,’ the robot might behave as though it is in robot-relative mode, as it will think it is always facing north or away from you on the field.

For reference, in the REV maxswerve code template, the second to last boolean parameter in the drive method for the DriveSubsystem is the fieldRelative parameter. When set to true, it should be driving in field-relative mode.

How would I check what the gyro is outputting? Would it be in the driver station or vs code? And if it is accurate, how would I make sure that the code is correctly using the outputs?

Probably the easiest is to push the value out to the SmartDashboard and the inspect it in the NetworkTables section.

SmartDashboard.putNumber("Gyro", variableWithTheGyroReading);

Just a simple log to the SmartDashboard should work fine within your drive method. Just put this line somewhere in there to see what the gyro is spitting out.
SmartDashboard.putNumber("Heading", gyro.getYaw())

Edit: Sniped by sokoloff

I think this is a small side-issue, if you’re getting an error that gyro.getyaw could not be resolved to a variable, this should be fixed first. Gyro most likely does not have a getyaw variable or field belonging to it, but rather the getYaw() function or method. Make sure you have the parenthesis after “getYaw”

I did this, and the gyro isn’t outputting any numbers to the smart dashboard at all, and I’ve tried changing the gyro to the spi port and changing the code along with it, but nothing worked. I’ve also changed the formatting for AHRS gyro = new AHRS(spi.port.kMXP/kCS0) Do the spi port or the direct connection to the roborio actually output data or is there some other specific way I have to plug it in or make the gyro in the code?

I would recommend keeping the code the way you have it given you have plugged in the navx via the mxp port on the roborio.
I don’t see anything wrong with the code from a glance so I would make sure everything is connected properly on the robot.

ThorMore:

gyro isn’t outputting any numbers to the smart dashboard at all

Do you mean the key name you used for the Dashboard display of the gyro does not appear or does it appear but the field is blank or the field appears but the number 0 is always displayed?

The orientation of the navX2-MXP matters. How is your roboRIO mounted? Flat or on an edge?

The NavX2-MXP on the roboRIO looks like this, right?

I think the NavX API automatically puts something on the dashboard so you know it is connected. I can’t remember what the field is, though. Is it showing on the dashboard?
